thread.title: 3 Florida festivals not to miss this week
thread.title_full: 3 Florida festivals not to miss this week | www.palmbeachpost.com

author: Post Features Staff
title: 3 Florida festivals not to miss this week
text:
1. FORT LAUDERDALE
Great Balls of Fire: Comets, Asteroids and Meteors. Through Jan. 3; Museum of Science and Discovery. See what could happen if asteroids or comets hit your hometown. Determine whether clips from Hollywood movies are science-right or science-wrong. Build your own solar system, including asteroid belts and comics. Monday-Saturday, 10 a.m.-5 p.m.; Sunday, noon-6 p.m. $13-$15. 401 SW Second St. 954-467-6637; mods.org
The Museum of Science and Discovery is hosting Great Balls of Fire: Comets, Asteroids and Meteors. 2. LIVE OAK
Magnolia Festival. Thursday-Sunday; Spirit of the Suwannee Music Park & Campground. Enjoy four days of live music in the middle of 800 acres of Spanish-moss-draped forest. More than 40 Americana-style musical acts will play four stages, with Jacksonville’s Tedeschi Trucks Band (Friday) and the Avett Brothers (Saturday) as headliners. Single- and four-day tickets available; visit website for details. magnoliafest.com
3. ST. PETERSBURG
The Tedeschi Trucks Band, with singer-guitarist Susan Tedeschi and guitarist Derek Trucks, will headline the Magnolia Festival in Live Oak this Thursday-Saturday. The Festival 2015. Friday and Saturday at the Coliseum. Also known as the Shelton Brothers Festival, this event focuses on St. Petersburg’s craft-beer scene through tastings and workshops. About 90 local, national and international makers of artisanal beer, cider and mead will be on hand. $10-$200. 535 4th Ave N. #thefestival2015; sheltonbrothers.com/festival
</span
